result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desree L Reimer

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Re: Order for Competency Examination by DHS

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:31 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF1232, 22CM1001.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Kay Yanke. 

Date and time set for initial appearance on both cases.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 

BOND:  $1500.00 cash bond to include both cases. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Jail sentence that was missed to be served within 7 days.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Atty Yanke raises competency on these matters; requests competency evaluation. 
ADA Zibolski requests PC be found; COURT makes findings and finds factual basis felony was committed; court finds probable cause on both matters. 
COURT orders competency evaluation be completed by DHS; evaluation to be completed within 15 days of incarceration. 
Atty Yanke will draft Orders for both cases; COURT will sign upon receipt. 

COURT sets 10/27/22 at 1:00 p.m. 

Adj:  2:37 p.m. 

Branch 5.

Includes cases 22CF1232 & 22CM1001. Jail sentence that was missed to be served within 7 days. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:28 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF1232, 22CM1001.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski.  
Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with intern, Krista Cannon and Atty Paige Metzman.   

COURT calls case a/k/a Archie Biddell per defendant.  

Date and time set for initial appearance.
Krista Cannon advises they were unable to meet with defendant in jail this morning.  
COURT advises right of counsel; Deft wishes to speak with SPD and wants to go home. 

COURT sets Adjourned IA 10/21/22 at 2:00 p.m. 

Adj:  2:30 p.m.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:14 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF1232, 22CM1001.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Paige Metzman.   

Date and time set for initial appearance.
Defendant is uncooperative on video appearance; COURT addresses deft.  Defendant refuses to participate in jail. 

COURT orders defendant to be held until 10/20/2022 at 2:00 p.m. 

Atty Metzman states deft refused to meet with her today in jail. 

Adj:  2:15 p.m.
